conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and manage user data fully even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids user control; the older adult wants to choose when to invite friends and participate, requiring user consent and control. These are opposite expectations about user control over app functions and data.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play games and chat digitally, so I can have fun and feel connected when I choose.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance developer control with user consent by defining clear user consent processes for app installation and data management while allowing social features with user approval.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data securely, ensuring user consent is obtained before sharing or installing apps.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to invite friends to play games and chat, so I can connect when I choose with control over sharing.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids user control. The older adult wants many health and exercise updates, relying on user data sharing, which requires allowing data sharing. These requirements contradict because one forbids user consent while the other requires it.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to give me many health and exercise updates so I can always know how I am doing.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance user consent and developer control by enabling user data sharing and app installation based on clear permissions and preferences.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with respect to user consent, so that privacy and control are ensured.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to provide health and exercise updates based on my data sharing preferences to stay informed about my well-being.

conflictDescription: The developer wants full control over app installation and user data even if users do not want to share or install apps, while the older person wants to chat freely with friends, which requires app installation and data sharing. The developer's requirement forbids actions that the older person's story requires to enable chatting.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to chat freely with known friends digitally to feel less lonely and connected.
resolutionDescription: Modify the developer's story to allow controlled app installation respecting user consent, and update the older person's story to include consent for app use, balancing control and user freedom.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation with user consent, so that user data and privacy are protected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to chat with friends using approved apps, so that I feel connected safely and easily.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids user choice. The older person wants to choose when to ask who is online, implying control over data sharing and app use. These are opposite expectations about user control and data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to ask ALFRED who is online to chat when I choose, so I can connect safely and comfortably.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance user choice and developer control by introducing consent-based app installation and data sharing that respects user preferences while allowing developers to manage apps securely.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data securely, while respecting user consent and preferences.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to choose when to ask who is online, so I can connect safely and control my data sharing.

conflictDescription: User Story A wants developers to control app installation and manage user data fully even if users do not want to share or install apps, while User Story B expects the system to allow older adults to start video calls, which requires app installation and data sharing. These opposite expectations about allowing or forbidding app installation and data use create a Start-Forbid conflict.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to start a video call with my niece using ALFRED, so that I can stay connected easily when I prefer digital contact.
resolutionDescription: Adjust User Story A to allow app installation and data sharing only with user consent, and update User Story B to require app installation and data sharing with clear user permission for video calls.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data with user consent, so that user privacy is respected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to start a video call with my niece using ALFRED, so that I can stay connected easily with my permission.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and user data even if users do not want to share or install apps (start operation), while the older person wants to order a taxi easily without problems, which implies the system should allow user-initiated app usage and data sharing. These opposing goals create a conflict about whether the system should allow or forbid user control over app actions.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to order a taxi fast and easy, so I can go out anytime I want without problems.
resolutionDescription: Adjust both stories to balance developer control with user autonomy by allowing app installation and data sharing only with user consent and in secure conditions.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data securely, respecting user consent for sharing and installation.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to order a taxi easily, so I can go out anytime without problems while keeping my data safe.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids user choice. The older adult wants to play games during chats, which requires installing and sharing apps, so the developer's control forbids the user's operation.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to play brain games during chats with different difficulty levels, so I can stay active and enjoy time with friends.
resolutionDescription: The developer's control is adapted to allow user consent before app installation and data sharing, and the older adult's desire to play games during chats is maintained with user permission.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data securely while respecting user consent for sharing and installation.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to play brain games during chats with friends, with apps installed only if I agree, to stay active and enjoy social time.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids user choice. The older adult wants to join exercise games voluntarily, implying user control over installation and participation. These requirements conflict because one forbids user control while the other requires it.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to join hard exercise games with ALFRED, so I can stay motivated and challenge myself.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to respect user consent and control over app installation and participation, while allowing developers to manage apps within these boundaries.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with user consent, so that privacy and control are respected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to join exercise games voluntarily, so I can stay motivated and enjoy challenges.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and user data fully, even if users refuse, but the older adult wants to explore technology with support, implying user consent and control. These goals conflict because one forbids user refusal, while the other expects user freedom to choose and learn.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to explore new technology challenges with support, so I can learn and grow at my own pace.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to ensure app installation and data management respect user consent while allowing developers to provide guided support and control under agreed conditions.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to install and manage apps with user consent, so that users have secure and supported access to new technology.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to explore new technology with support and control over app installation, so I can learn safely at my own pace.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires developers to fully control app installation and user data even if users do not want to share or install apps, which forbids automatic activation without user consent. User Story B requires ALFRED to turn on by itself when help is needed, implying automatic activation. This creates opposite expectations on system behavior for app activation and user control.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to turn on by itself when I need help, so I do not have to ask every time.
resolutionDescription: We introduce a context-aware policy where app installation and data control require user consent, but ALFRED can activate automatically in emergencies to provide help.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with user consent, so users keep control over their information.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to turn on by itself only in emergencies, so I get help without asking every time.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects the system to allow developers to install apps and manage user data even if users do not want this, while User Story B expects the system to allow only user-initiated communication, forbidding unwanted messages or actions. This creates opposite expectations about control over app installation and communication.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication with family and friends and avoid unwanted messages, allowing only chats I initiate.
resolutionDescription: The resolution applies a contextual policy layer that balances developer control with user consent, allowing app installation and data management only with user approval, while ensuring users control incoming communications.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data only with user consent, so that users keep control over their apps and data.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to control all communication and avoid unwanted messages, allowing only chats I start.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps, which conflicts with the older person's wish to arrange visits offline only and avoid digital contact. This means the system is asked both to enforce app installation and data sharing and to forbid digital contact at the same time.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits in person using ALFRED, so that I can keep full control and avoid digital contact when I prefer.
resolutionDescription: Adjust both user stories to allow app installation and data sharing when users agree, while respecting older persons' choice to prefer offline social visits and limit digital contact.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with user consent, to support personalized services safely.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange social visits in person and limit digital contact when I prefer, to keep control of my interactions.

conflictDescription: The developer wants to control app installation and user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps, while the older adult wants to keep full control and avoid surprise visits or calls. This creates opposite expectations about user control over system actions.
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to control app installation and manage user data fully, even if users do not want to share or install apps.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange nurse check-ins only at home and by myself, so that I keep full control and avoid surprise visits or calls.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance developer control with user consent, ensuring app installation and nurse check-ins happen only with the older adult's permission to avoid surprises while allowing management within agreed limits.
newUserStoryASummary: As a developer, I want to manage app installation and user data with user consent, so that users keep control and system stays secure.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to arrange nurse check-ins at home with my permission, so that I keep control and avoid surprise visits.
